Bahumangala cetiya：A shrine in Anurādhapura in the image house of which Dhātusena erected Bodhisatta figures．He also provided a diadem of rays for the Buddha images in the cetiya．These images were known as Kāselasatthā and Upasumbha （Cv．xxxviii．65）．

The cetiya is probably identical with the Mangala cetiya （q．v．）．
